ygData.subject: Crawl data size discrepancy
ygData.msgSnippet: There appears to be a discrepancy between the size totals reported in the crawl.log and crawl-report.txt (at least in H3). The crawl-report.txt always relies

There appears to be a discrepancy between the size totals reported in the c=
rawl.log and crawl-report.txt (at least in H3).

The crawl-report.txt alway=
s relies on CrawlURI.getContentSize() while the crawl.log will use CrawlURI=
.getContentLength() for most HTTP transactions.

At least when deduplicatio=
n is being used (by hash) there can be a very substantial difference betwee=
n the value reported in the crawl-report and in the crawl.log, with the cra=
wl.log being much lower.

Possibly this is because the size value for dupli=
cate content has been truncated in the recorder underlying curi.getContentL=
ength()? Perhaps when the WarcWriter writes a revisit record? It is not set=
 to zero but the size of detected duplicate is very substantially lower bas=
ed on the crawl.log than either the crawl-report or the deduplicator proces=
sor-report indicate (the latter two both relying on the contentSize are in =
full agreement about the volume of duplicate data).

This discrepancy makes=
 it impossible to rebuild the crawl-report from the crawl.log if a crawl te=
rminates abnormally. Furthermore, it means that the crawl log (at least in =
some circumstances) is not accurately reflecting the downloaded content.

D=
ata example:

Both agree on number of URIs

novel URIs: 3292190
duplicate-b=
y-hash URIs: 444040
not-modified URIs: 5

Total bytes crawl.log:    2236725=
78008   
Total bytes crawl-report: 302636807118

l.log:     24312507161
